Name: Randy Old-fashioned
Ingredients: 2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered Luxardo Maraschino Cherries .
Review: Port and brandy (rhymes 'Randy') are traditionally consumed at Christmas and used to be a popular British pub combo. I've used maple syrup in place of brown sugar syrup to lightly sweeten this festive after-dinner combo. The Sazerac was the inspiration for the choice of bitters and use of absinthe.
History: Created December 2014 by yours truly at the Cabinet Room, London, England. Old-Fashioned cocktail history and recipes
Nutrition: One serving of Randy Old-fashioned contains 213 calories
